section.p: You can export a terminology list to give it to another user, for example, another translator who needs it for the translation of another document. You can choose to export the list in or external format.
In order to exchange the data with other users, select the format. If you want to pass the list to another program, you should select the external format.
When you export in external format, the found terms lists and the new terms lists are exported in SGML format. You can find a description of this format in .
When you export an exclusion list in external format, it is written as an ASCII-coded file.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The list window that contains the terminology list to be exported is active.

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: Depending on the format selected, this window offers a different number of options and parameters.
For exporting in format, specify the following:

plentry.pd: Select the drive to which you want to export the terminology list.

section.p: For exporting in external format, specify the following:

plentry.pd: Specify the needed parameters where to store the terminology list and select the drive to which you want to export the list. Name Define the file name for the exported list. Current directory Displays the directory selected from the Directories list box. Directories Contains all available directories on the drive selected. Select the directory where to store the exported list.

section.p: To start the exporting function, select Export.

section.title: Results
section.p: The selected terminology list is now exported in the selected format. The file in the internal format can only be used by users. The file in the external format can be used or changed by other applications. In you find a description of how to work with external lists.
